Article title: Free energy profiles for unwrapping the outer superhelical turn of nucleosomal DNA
Authors: Kono H, Sakuraba S, Ishida H.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Main findings: DNA unwrapping free energy profiles, key histone-DNA contacts

Article title: Interactions of HP1 Bound to H3K9me3 Dinucleosome by Molecular Simulations and Biochemical Assays
Authors: Watanabe S, Mishima Y, Shimizu M, Suetake I, Takada S.
Model: Dinuceosome with full histone tails; mononuceosome with full histone tails and linker DNA
Main findings: Contacts between HP1 and methylated nucleosome; modes of HP1 interaction with dinucleosome

Article title: Investigating the Influence of Arginine Dimethylation on Nucleosome Dynamics Using All-Atom Simulations and Kinetic Analysis
Authors: Li Z, Kono H.
Model: Nucleosomes with linker DNA, full histone tails
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: arginine dimethylation of H3 histone (R42me2a, anti−anti R42me2s, anti−syn R42me2s, and R42A)
Main findings: More open conformation of DNA in the nucleosome entry/exit region with asymmetric dimethylation compared to symmetric dimethylation

Article title: Mechanical evolution of DNA double-strand breaks in the nucleosome
Authors: Cleri F, Landuzzi F, Blossey R.
Model: Nucleosome core particle
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: DNA double-strand breaks in different nucleosome positions
Main findings: DSB ends remained stable within the nucleosome, but showed partial unwrapping dynamics

Article title: Molecular Mechanism for the Role of the H2A and H2B Histone Tails in Nucleosome Repositioning
Authors: Chakraborty K, Kang M, Loverde SM.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, full-tails
Main findings: DNA loop or bulge formation near the SHL-5 region; role of H2A C-tail and H2B N-tail

Article title: The conformation of the histone H3 tail inhibits association of the BPTF PHD finger with the nucleosome
Authors: Morrison EA, Bowerman S, Sylvers KL, Wereszczynski J, Musselman CA.
Model: Nucleosome core particle with H3 tail modifications
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: modification states of the H3 tail: an unmodified tail, H3K4me3, and H3K14,18,23,27ac, H3K14,18,23,27ac, a combination of H3K4me3 and H3K14,18,23,27Q , and a combination of H3K4me3 and H3R8,17,26A .
Trajectory times, µs: 150 ns for a run, 13.5 µs in total
Main findings: H3 Acetylation weakens histone-DNA interactions and increase accessibility to the PHD finger

Article title: Free energy profile for unwrapping outer superhelical turn of CENP-A nucleosome
Authors: Kono H, Sakuraba S, Ishida H.
Model: Nucleosomes with linker DNA, full histone tails
Method: ABMD combined with multiple walker method + US
Force field: AMBER ff99SB for proteins, ff99bsc0 for DNA, ff99ions08 for ions
Main findings: The flexible conformation of the CENP-A nucleosome, which provides binding sites for the structural integrity of the centromere

Article title: Histone Octamer Structure Is Altered Early in ISW2 ATP-Dependent Nucleosome Remodeling
Authors: Hada A, Hota SK, Luo J, Lin Y chi, Kale S, Shaytan AK, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle , truncated histone tails
Main findings: Diisulphide bridges between H3 and H4 histones affect nucleosome geometry

Article title: Histone Tail Dynamics in Partially Disassembled Nucleosomes During Chromatin Remodeling
Authors: Kameda T, Awazu A, Togashi Y.
Model: Nucleosome core particle with full histone tails; hexasomes with full histone tails
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: Lacking each one H2A-H2B or H3-H4 dimer
Main findings: Dynamics and stability of nucleosome structures lacking a histone dimer

Article title: Molecular Mechanism of Spontaneous Nucleosome Unraveling
Authors: Winogradoff D, Aksimentiev A.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Ion concentration: 0.15 M NaCl, 1.0 M MgCl2, and 3.0 M NaCl.
Main findings: Spontaneous DNA unwrapping, 1 bp shift as a result of DNA rewinding, influence of sequence and salt concentration

Article title: Unique Dynamics in Asymmetric macroH2A–H2A Hybrid Nucleosomes Result in Increased Complex Stability
Authors: Bowerman S, Hickok RJ, Wereszczynski J.
Model: Nucleosome core particles, full histone tails
Main findings: Distinct dynamics, potential impact on higher order chromatin structures and transcriptional activity of energetically favourable hybrid nucleosome formation

Article title: Elucidating the influence of linker histone variants on chromatosome dynamics and energetics
Authors: Woods DC, Wereszczynski J.
Model: Nucleosome core particle with full histone tails (MD); isolated linker histones genGH1 and GH1.0 (MD and US); chromatosomes (MD)
Trajectory times, µs:
Classic MD
0,25*3 for each of 7 systems

US
0,02*41
for each of 2 systems
Main findings: Thermodynamic basis for different linker histone binding motifs, their physical and chemical effects on chromatosomes

Article title: Emergence of chromatin hierarchical loops from protein disorder and nucleosome asymmetry
Authors: Sridhar A, Farr SE, Portella G, Schlick T, Orozco M, Collepardo-Guevara R.
Model: Full-sized chromatosome; reduced (partial) chromatosome; isolated H1 N-terminal domain; isolated H1 C-terminal domain
Force field: Amber99sb-ILDN + parmbsc0; Amber03ws + parmbsc0; Charmm36M + Charmm36 DNA
Main findings: Disorder of nucleosome-bound H1 and its effect on chromatin organisation

Article title: Impact of the Nucleosome Histone Core on the Structure and Dynamics of DNA-Containing Pyrimidine–Pyrimidone (6–4) Photoproduct
Authors: Matoušková E, Bignon E, Claerbout VEP, Dršata T, Gillet N, Monari A, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Main findings: The pyrimidine-pyrimidone (6-4) photoproduct lesion in nucleosomal DNA affects local DNA dynamics, which may be key to recognition by repair factors.

Article title: Minimal Cylinder Analysis Reveals the Mechanical Properties of Oncogenic Nucleosomes
Authors: Pitman M, Dalal Y, Papoian GA.
Model: Nucleosome core particles, truncated histone tails
Force field: amber99SB*-ILDN for proteins, amber99SB parmbsc0 for DNA, ions08 for ions
Main findings: A new theoretical approach, called minimal cylinder analysis; the intermediate elasticity of the heterotypic nucleosome compared to CENP-A and H3; nucleosome dynamics that are conserved and distributed across the nucleosome pseudodyad

Article title: Nucleosomal DNA Dynamics Mediate Oct4 Pioneer Factor Binding
Authors: Huertas J, MacCarthy CM, Schöler HR, Cojocaru V.
Model: Nucleosome with linker DNA and full histone tails
Main findings: First nucleosome-Oct4 complex model, correlation between region mobility and binding site position

Article title: Nucleosomal embedding reshapes the dynamics of abasic sites
Authors: Bignon E, Claerbout VEP, Jiang T, Morell C, Gillet N, Dumont E.
Model: Nucleosome core particles with AP-sites at SHL 4.5, full-length histone tails
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: Apurinic/apyrimidinic (AP) sites (deoxyribose- and tetrahydrofuran-type abasic sites)
Main findings: Isolated AP sites altered nucleosomal DNA geometry; histones (mainly tails) formed contacts with the DNA lesion, which can lead to DNA-protein cross-linking.

Article title: Orientation Dependence of Inter-NCP Interaction: Insights into the Behavior of Liquid Crystal Phase and Chromatin Fiber Organization
Authors: Saurabh S, Jang YH, Lansac Y, Maiti PK.
Model: Parallel and antiparallel stacked nucleosome core particles
Force field: AMBER ff10 with the ff99SB parameters + parmbsc0
Main findings: Role of histone tails in NCP stacking and the difference in unstacking pathways from parallel and antiparallel orientations

Article title: Structural Studies of Overlapping Dinucleosomes in Solution
Authors: Matsumoto A, Sugiyama M, Li Z, Martel A, Porcar L, Inoue R, et al.
Model: Overlapping dinucleosome composed of hexasome and octasome
Main findings: Investigation of atomic models of the overlapping dinucleosome in solution using SAXS, SANS, computer modelling and MD simulations

Article title: A Dynamic View of the Interaction of Histone Tails with Clustered Abasic Sites in a Nucleosome Core Particle
Authors: Bignon E, Gillet N, Jiang T, Morell C, Dumont E.
Model: Nucleosome core particles with AP-sites at SHL 1.5, sligtly truncated histone tails
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: Isolated, clustered, and tandem AP sites
Main findings: Clustered AP sites influence nucleosomal DNA geometry, but much less than B-DNA; histone-lesion contacts are described

Article title: Binding of regulatory proteins to nucleosomes is modulated by dynamic histone tails
Authors: Peng Y, Li S, Onufriev A, Landsman D, Panchenko AR.
Model: Nucleosome with linker DNA
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: lysine acetylation, lysine trimethylation, serine/threonine phosphorylation, and Arg → Ala substitutions
Main findings: Kinetics of tail binding to DNA, effects of PTMs

Article title: CENP-A Nucleosome is a Sensitive Allosteric Scaffold for DNA and Chromatin Factors
Authors: Doğan D, Arslan M, Uluçay T, Kalyoncu S, Dimitrov S, Kale S.
Model: Nucleosome core particles with and without antibody-bound
Main findings: The sensitivity of CENP-A nucleosomes as allosteric scaffolds for DNA and chromatin factors

Article title: Distinct Structures and Dynamics of Chromatosomes with Different Human Linker Histone Isoforms.
Authors: Zhou BR, Feng H, Kale S, Fox T, Khant H, De Val N, et al.
Model: Nucleosome with linker DNA and without histone tails; chromatosomes
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: Tailless H1.0, H1.4 and H1.10 linker histones; H1.4 R53A mutant
Trajectory times, µs:
0.5 for each of 4 systems

0.22 for H1.4 R53A mutant system
Main findings: Distinct structural and dynamic features of the chromatosomes

Article title: Effects of H2A.B incorporation on nucleosome structures and dynamics
Authors: Kohestani H, Wereszczynski J.
Model: Nucleosome core particles, full histone tails
Force field: Amber ff14SB for protein + OL15 for DNA
Trajectory times, µs: 0.55 for classic MD (8.8 in total), 1.6 for ABMD (4.8 in total)
Main findings: Weaker protein-protein and protein-DNA interactions for the H2A.B nucleosome, resulting in more DNA opening at the entry and exit sites.

Article title: Histone dynamics mediate DNA unwrapping and sliding in nucleosomes
Authors: Armeev GA, Kniazeva AS, Komarova GA, Kirpichnikov MP, Shaytan AK.
Model: Nucleosome core particle (full tails, truncated tails)
Main findings: DNA breathing and unwrapping, H3-latch, DNA sliding, H2A a2-helix bending

Article title: Histone H4 Tails in Nucleosomes: a Fuzzy Interaction with DNA
Authors: Rabdano SO, Shannon MD, Izmailov SA, Gonzalez Salguero N, Zandian M, Purusottam RN, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, full histone tails
Force field:
Amber ff14SB (+CUFIX),
 CHARMM c36m, Amber ff15ipq
Main findings: TIP4P-D water model gives reasonable agreement with R1-R2 NMR parameters

Article title: Histone tails cooperate to control the breathing of genomic nucleosomes
Authors: Huertas J, Schöler HR, Cojocaru V.
Model: 168-bp nucleosome (full tails, truncated tails)
Main findings: Spontaneous DNA breathing, interplay with histone tail dynamics (H2A C-tail and H3 N-tail)

Article title: Mechanisms of Nucleosome Reorganization by PARP1
Authors: Maluchenko NV, Nilov DK, Pushkarev SV, Kotova EY, Gerasimova NS, Kirpichnikov MP, et al.
Model: Nucleosome with one-sided linker DNA, truncated histone tails
Main findings: PARP1-induced nucleosomal DNA distortion

Article title: Molecular dynamics simulations reveal how H3K56 acetylation impacts nucleosome structure to promote DNA exposure for lesion sensing
Authors: Fu I., Geacintov N.E., Suse Broyde S.
Model: Nucleosome core particle with a cis-B[a]P-dG adduct[a iat SHL 6.25 (DNA minor groove) or/and acetylated H3 K56
Main findings: H3K56ac affects H3 αN helix and local DNA dynamics, increasing DNA lesion site exposure

Article title: Nucleosome composition regulates the histone H3 tail conformational ensemble and accessibility
Authors: Morrison EA, Baweja L, Poirier MG, Wereszczynski J, Musselman CA.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, hexosome,stetrasome
Method: MD with hydrogen mass repartitioning (HMR), in water and explicit/implicit solvent
Main findings: H3 N-tail conformation ensemble in nucleosome, hexasome, and tetrasome

Article title: The Dynamic Influence of Linker Histone Saturation within the Poly-Nucleosome Array
Authors: Woods DC, Rodríguez-Ropero F, Wereszczynski J.
Model: Octanucleosome array with and without GH1
Main findings: The effects of linker histone binding on an octanucleosome model of the chromatin fiber

Article title: The N-terminal Tails of Histones H2A and H2B Adopt Two Distinct Conformations in the Nucleosome with Contact and Reduced Contact to DNA
Authors: Ohtomo H, Kurita J ichi, Sakuraba S, Li Z, Arimura Y, Wakamori M, et al.
Model: Nucloesome core particle, full histone tails; H2A N-tail with surrounding residues
Main findings: Distinct conformational states of H2A and H2B N-tails

Article title: Torsional stress can regulate the unwrapping of two outer half superhelical turns of nucleosomal DNA
Authors: Ishida H, Kono H.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Main findings: Asymmetric DNA unwrapping under positive and negative stress

Article title: DNA methylation cues in nucleosome geometry, stability and unwrapping
Authors: Li S, Peng Y, Landsman D, Panchenko AR.
Model: Nucleosomes with linker DNA, full histone tails
Main findings: Changes in DNA geometry that enhance interactions between methylated DNA and the histone octamer

Article title: Free Energy Landscape of H2A-H2B Displacement From Nucleosome
Authors: Ishida H, Kono H.
Model: Nucleosome core particle with truncated histone tails and residues Val107-Lys128 of H2A
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: H2A-H2B dimer displacement from the nucleosome
Main findings: Intra-nucleosomal interactions and free energies for the H2A-H2B displacement

Article title: H2A-H2B Histone Dimer Plasticity and Its Functional Implications
Authors: Kniazeva AS, Armeev GA, Shaytan AK.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails; H2A-H2B dimer (intact or bound to DNA fragment)
Main findings: H2A-H2B dimer bending upon DNA unwrapping, sliding and H2A/H2A.Z sequence variation

Article title: H2B Lys34 Ubiquitination Induces Nucleosome Distortion to Stimulate Dot1L Activity
Authors: Ai H, Sun M, Liu A, Sun Z, Liu T, Cao L, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Main findings: DotL activation due to distorted nucleosome structure

Article title: OCT4 interprets and enhances nucleosome flexibility
Authors: MacCarthy CM, Huertas J, Ortmeier C, vom Bruch H, Tan DS, Reinke D, et al.
Model: Nucleosome with linker DNA, full or truncated histone tails
Main findings: Oct4 induces breathing and may latch nucleosome in open conformation

Article title: Coupling of conformation and CPD damage in nucleosomal DNA
Authors: Nayis A, Liebl K, Zacharias M.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, isolated DNA
Main findings: Local geometry of nucleosomal DNA influences the potential for CPD damage formation

Article title: Histone variant H2A.Z modulates nucleosome dynamics to promote DNA accessibility
Authors: Li S, Wei T, Panchenko AR.
Model: Nucleosome core particles, full histone tails, 20 bp linkers
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: H2A.Z, H3.3, H2A with H2A.Z C-terminal tail, H2A.Z with H2A C-terminal tail
Force field: OL15 for DNA + amber ff14SB for proteins
Main findings: Spontaneous DNA unwrapping of about forty base pairs from both ends, nucleosome gapping and increased histone plasticity

Article title: Interactions of Nucleosomes with Acidic Patch-Binding Peptides: A Combined Structural Bioinformatics, Molecular Modeling, Fluorescence Polarization, and Single-Molecule FRET Study
Authors: Oleinikov PD, Fedulova AS, Armeev GA, Motorin NA, Singh-Palchevskaia L, Sivkina AL, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Main findings: Histone core reorganisation upon peptide binding

Article title: Molecular Mechanism of Nucleosome Recognition by the Pioneer Transcription Factor Sox
Authors: Ozden B, Boopathi R, Barlas AB, Lone IN, Bednar J, Petosa C, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, truncated histone tails
Main findings: Sox11-nucleosome complexes at different positions

Article title: Nucleosome Array Deformation in Chromatin is Sustained by Bending, Twisting and Kinking of Linker DNA
Authors: Cleri F, Giordano S, Blossey R.
Model: Two trinucleosome systems with 22 and 36 bp linkers
Main findings:
The structural effects of mechanical compression on the trinucleosome
on the trinucleosome.

Article title: Nucleosome dyad determines the H1 C-terminus collapse on distinct DNA arms
Authors: Louro JA, Boopathi R, Beinsteiner B, Mohideen Patel AK, Cheng TC, Angelov D, et al.
Model: Chromatosomes with linkers, truncated core histone tails, and H1 globular domain only; chromosomes with linkers, truncated core histone tails, and H1 globular and partial C-terminal domains
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: H1.0b with partial C-terminal domain; globular domain only H1
Main findings: Coupling between H1 C-terminal tail collapse on linker DNA and globular domain orientation. Proposal of the ''Swiss army knife model'' for the H1 globular domain

Article title: Structural and Dynamic Changes of Nucleosome upon GATA3 Binding
Authors: Ishida H, Matsumoto A, Tanaka H, Okuda A, Morishima K, Wade PA, et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, full histone tails
Main findings: First GATA3-nucleosome complex model, effects of GATA3 on breathing

Article title: CENP-N promotes the compaction of centromeric chromatin
Authors: Zhou, K., Gebala, M., Woods, D. et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particle, full-length histone tails, in complex with CENP-N protein
Main findings: CENP-N protein interacts with two nucleosomes and stabilises their stacking.

Article title: The effects of RNA.DNA-DNA triple helices on nucleosome structures and dynamics
Authors: Kohestani H, Wereszczynski J.
Model: Intact DNA and nucleosome with full-length histone tails (or truncated H3 tail)
DNA sequence: 601 Widom for histone core: linker DNA with or without truplex targeting site
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: DNA-DNA-RNA triple helix in linker DNA region (24 nucleotide RNA)
Force field: Amber ff14SB, OL15, OL3, and OPC  (for protein, DNA, RNA, and water, respectively),  Joung and Cheatham model for ions
Main findings: RNA interacts stably with nucleosome linker DNA in the presence of triplex target site and/or H3 tail

Article title: Molecular mechanism of histone variant H2A.B on stability and assembly of nucleosome and chromatin structures
Authors: Peng, J., Yuan, C., Hua, X. et al.
Model: Nucleosome core particles with histone tails, H2A.B variant histone
Variations/ modifications/ interaction: H2A-NCP, H2A.B-NCP, Mutants: H2A–CtH2A.B NCP, the H2A–DDH2A.B NCP, the H2A–L2H2A.B NCP, and the NtH2A–H2A.B NCP
Main findings: DNA unwinding is enhanced by H2A.B incorporation; role of L2 loop, C-terminal tail
